name: Thunderbird: Theme support tweaks for Windows 8
description: Adjusts Thunderbird's "lightweight theme"/"persona" effects to be more akin to those of Firefox on Windows 10: "overlays" buttons on top of the theme's background instead of "cutting out" holes for them; fixes the window's top border color not match with system border color.
additional_info: This small userstyle is a fix to a subject of personal bother, which is the looks of "lightweight themes" in Thunderbird. These are some small details: 1. Instead of blending or overlaying the window controls, a shape is cut out for them in UI. But not just any shape, but the one specifically designated for Windows 7' buttons. This is the reason to why there's additional empty space to the left of "minimize" button and a 1-pixel "cut" on the "close" button. 2. The program's top border has colors hardcoded to resemble those of Windows 7' window frame. Which, perhaps somewhat unsurprisingly, are not the same as Windows 8' window frame colors. So this fixes both of those - borders by undoing the associated change and shifting the background downwards (so that the system border is visible), and buttons by overlaying [on top of the background] a set of semi-transparent buttons that are at the exact positions as the system buttons. Known issues: Buttons do not have a "hover" state. It appears like ":hover" pseudo-class simply doesn't trigger for titlebar buttons for some reason. Feel free to edit the userstyle to your liking. I've settled for white minimize/maximize buttons, for example, but there may be better options. Have fun!
